Interactive Order Module

interactive_order.py

This module handles the process of taking a pizza order from the user at a pizzeria.

The user is prompted to customize their pizza with choices for crust, sauce, and toppings. They can also cancel the operation at any time by pressing ‘Q’. The module ensures that only valid inputs are accepted, enforces that only one crust can be selected per pizza, and automatically removes duplicate selections for sauces and toppings.

Cancellation

  • The user can cancel the entire order process at any time by entering ‘Q’ at any prompt.

Payment

  • After finishing the order, the user is asked if they have paid. If confirmed, the order is marked as paid.

Example

  • The user is prompted to customize their pizza, adding crust, sauce, and toppings, and can continue to order more pizzas or cancel the order process.

src.interactive_order.choose_crust()

Ask the user to choose a pizza crust type.

Valid options include Thick, Thin, Gluten Free.

src.interactive_order.get_valid_input(prompt, valid_options, item_name)

Prompt the user to enter a list of valid items (e.g., sauces, toppings).

This function repeatedly asks the user for input until a valid list of options from the predefined valid options is provided. It also removes any duplicate selections, preserving the original order.

Special handling is done for the ‘crust’ item to allow only a single choice.

Parameters:

  • prompt (str) – The message displayed to the user asking for input.

  • valid_options (list) – A list of valid options that the user can choose from.

  • item_name (str) – The name of the item being selected to personalize the prompt and error messages.

Returns:

A list of valid, unique items chosen by the user, stripped of whitespace.

Return type:

list of str

Raises:

SystemExit – If the user enters ‘q’ to cancel the order.

src.interactive_order.take_order_from_user()

Manage the process of taking a pizza order from the user.

This includes allowing the user to order multiple pizzas with customizable crust, sauces, and toppings. The user can cancel the order at any time by pressing ‘Q’.

After the user finishes their order, the order is confirmed and marked as paid if the user has paid.

Returns:

None
